unit.name: 99 Infantry Division HQ
unit.History: The 99th Division was activated on November 12, 1942, and arrived in Europe almost two years later. The division entered combat on November 9, 1944. When the German assault in the Ardennes started, part of the division was under command of the 2nd Division.

commander.Name: Walter E. Lauer
commander.PersBio: Lauer was born in Brooklyn, New York on 29 June, 1893. He was still a student at Cornell University when the US entered World War One in April 1917 and served temporarily with the occupation forces before returning to the USA in 1923. In 1943 He was made Chief of Staff with the 3rd Infantry Division and sent to North Africa. He took command of the 99th Division while it was training in the US in late 1943.
commander.Title: CO
